title: Helioterra 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine all comes from Oasis Vineyard in the Yakima Valley. Its red fruit, baking spice and medicine cabinet aromas are a bit difficult to tease out. The flavors, meanwhile, are at once lightly styled and jammy, finishing short with cranberry notes.

title: Heretat Montrubí NV Gaintus Espumoso Tradicional Sumoll (Penedès)
description: Floral yet flat aromas are leafy and a touch green on the nose. This 100% Sumoll rosé feels peachy and simple, with stone-fruit and berry flavors. Mild raspberry notes lend a red-fruit character to a wide but shapeless finish.

title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Gris (Monterey)
description: There's a touch of fizz to the glass in this twist-top bottling, which shows light peach, yellow melon, sliced apple and orange-cake aromas. The flavors are subtle but the texture is decent with acidity and grip, allowing ripe pear and a touch of lime bitterness to arise slowly.

title: La Honda Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite shy at first, and then slowly arise aromas of citrus pith, sliced Gravenstein apple and a mushroomy, woody component. The palate's citrus rinds, pomelo pith and hints of tangerine are presented on a well-wound frame.

title: Las Vertientes 2016 Benchmark Red (Mendoza)
description: This Malbec-led blend has black fruit aromas with hints of Band-Aid and licorice root. It's chewy and dense but also a bit flat. Its plum and berry flavors are moderately oaky, showing rubbery tannins and an herbal aftertaste on the finish.

title: Long 2015 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Petit Verdot (Red Mountain)
description: From an up-and-coming vineyard, this exudes light green herb, macerated cherry, violet, citrus and barrel spice aromas. On the palate, full, slightly green dark fruit flavors are backed by tart acidity. The tannins are a touch dry, but there's promise here.

title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015  Saint-Aubin
description: A rich, fruity wine, this is rounded and ripe with white fruits. It shows a crisp edge and a touch of spice from oak aging. It will develop quickly to give an attractive wine from late 2018.

title: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sourced from Art Den Hoed and Gunkel vineyards, this wine has high-toned red apple and barrel spice aromas and ripe, sweet red raspberry flavors. It's interesting, albeit cloying.

title: Naveran 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of orange and vanilla turn more burnt and smoky as this Pinot Noir-Parellada brut rosé opens up. The highly foamy mouthfeel carries rustic, spicy citrus flavors.

title: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Gewürztraminer (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's aromas are a bit disjointed, its rose petal and spice notes seeming dried out. The palate is quite sweet, without the acidity to back it up.
designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut

title: Pablo Claro 2016 Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Mild white-fruit aromas carry the nose of this Biodynamic Sauvignon Blanc. Angular, tangy flavors of gooseberry and green plum carry the flavors and finish crisp and clean.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Mellow aromas of pear, rainy sidewalk and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. There is bountiful acidity on the sip, with cut grass and apple skin flavors.

title: Planeta 2016 Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of orchard fruit and white flower lift out of the glass while the tangy palate offers citrus, yellow apple, saline and a hint of bitter almond. It's racy, with vibrant acidity.

title: San Cassiano 2015  Valpolicella
description: This opens with delicate aromas of baking spice and black-skinned fruit. It's easygoing, offering black cherry, red plum and vanilla alongside round tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2016 Relax Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)
description: Fresh black cherry and plum are ripe and forward in this easy drinking Pinot Noir. It's a soft, sunny wine, with delicate acidity and plush tannins but refreshingly fruity. Drink now.

title: St. Christopher 2016 Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)
description: Earthy mineral notes are brightened by whiffs of white blossom and grapefruit in this subtly sweet Gewürztraminer. Soft acidity and feather-light texture add to its delicate feel. Drink now through 2019.

title: Tenuta Da Mar 2015 Opera Terza  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Opening aromas suggest black-skinned berry and cooking spice. The firm palate shows ripe black cherry, nutmeg and cocoa alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Tenuta Da Mar 2016  Valpolicella
description: This opens with aromas of red plum, cooking spice and a hint of nutmeg. The no-frills palate shows black currant, clove and a black pepper note alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Torii Mor 2015 Alloro Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This excellent vineyard designate usually shows better, but here, the awkward, chalky acids overtake the cherry fruit. It may need more time in bottle, or may simply have required a different approach to acid adjustment during the winemaking process.

title: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2008 Terra del Cereo  (Valpolicella Superiore)
description: Aromas of toast, tobacco and a hint of black-skinned berry meld together on this wine. The dense, robust palate delivers prune, vanilla and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Troon 2016 Vermentino (Applegate Valley)
description: Troon makes a pair of Vermentinos; this is the one with the red label. It's a spicy, peppery white with a funky kick to the finish. A mix of cucumber, lime and apple fruit, it carries a rather surprising leathery scent and flavor. Some tasters will consider that a plus.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Famiglia Bianchi Nebbiolo-Malbec Red (Mendoza)
description: This unusual blend of Nebbiolo and Malbec feels compact but hard. Its reedy, stalky berry aromas are fiery, earthy and herbal. On the palate, spicy, herbal plum and berry flavors finish with peppery, minty notes.

title: Vista Hills 2015 Rollins Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Two bottles of this wine were tasted, with vast differences. The first was dominated by a leathery, tack room aroma, which carried into the palate and obliterated the fruit. Some tasters attribute this to terroir, but it's in fact a flaw. The second bottle was much improved, showing black cherry fruit and proportionate tannins. The score is for that bottle, but beware the possibility of extreme variation.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Tualatin Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's cherry-like fruit is plenty ripe, and the acidity has fresh-squeezed orange juice appeal. The only off note is a hint of plastic on the nose that carries into the palate.

title: Château Bianca 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This coppery gold-hued wine is soft, round and dry and suggests early oxidation. Its simple tree fruit flavors bear a touch of lemon and honeycomb, though the finish is completely dry.

title: Bodega Toneles 2016 Tonel 14 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This basic, medium-bodied wine has straightforward plum and berry aromas. Its cherry, currant and mild chocolate flavors hum along, with little to no change on the finish. This may be simple, but it works.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2015 Inspiración Alto Cantabria Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: Peach, mango and crushed-stone aromas lead to a cidery, streamlined palate. Salty stone-fruit flavors lead in this barrel-aged Tempranillo Blanco, a fairly rare wine even for Rioja. On the finish, this is plump but lacking in structure. Drink now.

title: Contrade di Taurasi - Lonardo 2014 Greco Musc' Burlesque Roviello (Campania)
description: Made with Roviello Bianco and vinified in both steel and tonneaux, this deeply colored white wine has aromas of toasted oak, nut and a whiff of citrus peel that carry over to the palate. It's lean in terms of fruit richness, offering tangy sensations of just-squeezed lemon, saline, and a hint of yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity. An almond note closes the bitter finish.

title: Corte Adami 2015  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
description: Subdued aromas suggest prune, vanilla and baking spice while the ripe, straightforward palate presents fleshy black plum, toast and a hint of pipe tobacco. Smooth tannins lend easygoing support.

title: Corte Moschina 2015  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry and tilled earth. The straightforward palate offers ripe black cherry, mocha and a hint of cinnamon while round tannins provide easygoing support. Drink through 2020.
